revision.text: Possibly: A collection of English exercises. Translated from the writings of Cicero only, for school-boys to re-translate into Latin; and adapted to the principal rules in the compendium of Erasmus's Syntax. By William Ellis, A.M. And Master of the Grammar School at Alford, in Lincolnshire. (London : printed for G. Robinson, and R. Baldwin, Pater-noster-Row, MDCCLXXXII. [1782]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2464599~S1
